title: Shim
summary: A shim is a piece of code used to correct the behavior of code that already exists, usually by adding new API that works around the problem. This differs from a polyfill, which implements a new API that is not supported by the stock browser as shipped.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
